titleStmt.title: In Vlpiani Fulwelli operis laudem Richardi Coppoci Carmen.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: In Vlpiani Fulwelli operis laudem Richardi Coppoci Carmen.

monogr.title: The flovver of fame : Containing the bright renowne, & moste fortunate raigne of King Henry the viii. Wherein is mentioned of matters, by the rest of our cronographers ouerpassed. Compyled by Vlpian Fulwell. Hereunto is annexed (by the aucthor) a short treatice of iii. noble and vertuous queenes. And a discourse of the worthie seruice that was done at Hadington in Scotlande, the seconde yere of the raigne of king Edward the sixt
monogr.author: Fulwell, Ulpian

div.head: In Vlpiani Fulwelli operis laudem Richardi Coppoci Carmen.

lg.l: SI tibi cognitio rerum, si nuntia veri,
Si studium pacis, seu te laus inclyta belli
Incitet: huc celerem ferto referto pedem,
Hic res non rerum species, hic viuida virtus:
Non hic aiacis flos est Telamone creati
Qui domino dignum nil nisi nomen habet
Nec flos quo Phaebus genutus inscripsit acerbos,
Cum suus Oebalides, morte peremptus erat,
Sed flos hic famae merito regalis habendus,
